title: Trump isolated after trade escalation with Europe over Greenland
subhed: The president's threats could undermine the agreement reached by the United States and the European Union in the summer of 2025.

title: French PM announces taxes on large companies to break budget deadlock

From Trump to Nvidia, Davos prepares for American might
subhed: The president of the world's largest economy is attending the World Economic Forum in Switzerland from January 19 to January 23, positioning himself as a conqueror. This year's edition will be shaped by rising international tensions and artificial intelligence.

title: Iranian artists exiled in France voice distress over massacres
subhed: Petrified by the horror stories coming out of the country, Iranian artists living in exile in France keep a close eye on their home. They worry about their loved ones and eagerly await rare news, which is often relayed by someone lucky enough to escape the internet blackout.

title: Gen Z thirsts for a digital detox: 'I felt bad after every use, quitting lifted a huge weight off me'
subhed: More and more young people are feeling dependent on their screens, and taking steps to regain control over their digital device use by deleting social media apps and limiting their screen time.

title: The strange airborne rescue of Gaza's donkeys, from Israel to Europe
subhed: Since 2022, Sharon Cohen, who runs an animal rescue group near Tel Aviv, has removed donkeys from Palestinian owners she accuses of mistreatment and sent them to shelters across Europe. The initiative has drawn outrage amid Gaza's deepening humanitarian crisis.

Minneapolis emerges as new epicenter of resistance to Trump: 'ICE wasn't expecting that'
subhed: For several weeks, Minnesota's largest metropolitan area has been living under the strain of Operation Metro Surge, which saw the deployment of 2,000 Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers. Since the death of Renee Good on January 7, tensions with residents have reached a peak.

title: From Monroe to Trump: Two centuries of US interference in Latin America
subhed: From the Monroe Doctrine of 1823 to the intervention in Venezuela, Washington has dominated the American continent by force and through economic power. Faced with China's growing influence, Donald Trump has rejuvenated the notion of a 'manifest destiny.'

title: Mercosur trade deal will have uneven effects on EU countries
subhed: From Dutch ultra-productivism to Greek micro-farms, European agriculture – already weakened by climate change, animal epidemics and competition – has struggled to present a united front in response to the free trade agreement.
